news.headline: Trump administration moves to overrule state laws protecting credit reports from medical debt
news.summary: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has drafted what’s known as an interpretative rule. It says the FCRA should preempt any state laws or regulations when it comes to how debt should be reported. More than a dozen states like New York and Delaware prohibit the reporting of medical debt.
news.article_text:
NEW YORK (AP) — The Trump administration is moving to overrule any state laws that may protect consumers’ credit reports from medical debt and other debt issues.

The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has drafted what’s known as an interpretative rule related to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, interpreting the law in a way that says the FCRA should preempt any state laws or regulations when it comes to how debt should be reported to the credit bureaus like Experian, Equifax and Trans Union.

news.headline: Box Demand Drop Stings Packaging Firms
news.summary: Shares of Smurfit Westrock tumbled 12% Wednesday after the paper-packaging firm reduced its 2025 profit forecast and said it would take down time at its facilities because of weak packaging demand.  The box maker's warnings are the latest sign pointing to declining cardboard demand, which in turn suggests slowing a slowing economy.  Demand for cardboard boxes has become a popular way to forecast economic growth and consumer spending, given that everything from fruits and vegetables to factory parts gets shipped in corrugated packaging.

news.headline: Trump administration moves to overrule state laws protecting credit reports from medical debt
news.summary: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has drafted what’s known as an interpretative rule. It says the FCRA should preempt any state laws or regulations when it comes to how debt should be reported. More than a dozen states like New York and Delaware prohibit the reporting of medical debt.
news.article_text:
NEW YORK (AP) — The Trump administration is moving to overrule any state laws that may protect consumers’ credit reports from medical debt and other debt issues.

The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has drafted what’s known as an interpretative rule related to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, interpreting the law in a way that says the FCRA should preempt any state laws or regulations when it comes to how debt should be reported to the credit bureaus like Experian, Equifax and Trans Union.

news.headline: Box Demand Drop Stings Packaging Firms
news.summary: Shares of Smurfit Westrock tumbled 12% Wednesday after the paper-packaging firm reduced its 2025 profit forecast and said it would take down time at its facilities because of weak packaging demand.  The box maker's warnings are the latest sign pointing to declining cardboard demand, which in turn suggests slowing a slowing economy.  Demand for cardboard boxes has become a popular way to forecast economic growth and consumer spending, given that everything from fruits and vegetables to factory parts gets shipped in corrugated packaging.

news.headline: W.P. Carey's Q3 FFO Surpasses Estimates, Revenues Grow Y/Y
news.summary: W.P. Carey WPC reported third-quarter 2025 adjusted funds from operations (AFFO) per share of $1.25. The figure improved 5.9% from the year-ago quarter. WPC raised its full-year 2025 AFFO per share guidance
news.article_text:
W.P. Carey WPC reported third-quarter 2025 adjusted funds from operations (AFFO) per share of $1.25, surpassing the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.23. The figure improved 5.9% from the year-ago quarter.

Results reflected higher revenues, aided by strong investment activity and a disciplined disposition strategy. WPC raised its full-year 2025 AFFO per share guidance.

news.article_text:
Boston Properties Inc.’s BXP third-quarter 2025 funds from operations (FFO) per share of $1.74 surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.72. However, the reported figure fell 3.9% year over year.

BXP’s quarterly results reflect better-than-anticipated revenues on healthy leasing activity. However, lower occupancy during the quarter marred the performance to some extent. BXP also revised its guidance for 2025 FFO per share.
